name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: And another update as this thread does pop up from time to time: there will be a fourth instalment of #OperationMallard in April 2022 as there are currently 8 eggs in a nest on Dad's balcony! I've started a new thread for it, and will update there!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: That's all the news for now. I will keep you posted and let you know when all the eggs have been laid. I just wanted to let you know that it's happening again this year because heaven knows we need some good news amidst all the horror. Hopefully this has made you smile.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: We were worried it might not happen this year, as the building is due to have the cladding and the balconies replaced. But Mrs Mallard got there before work started, and I bet my Dad will make sure that she is not disturbed until those ducklings are safe on the ground :)

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: In the mean time, he found out about a very early brood that hatched a few days ago in the area. 13 ducklings! He went and found them yesterday to feed them, as he's worried about them surviving so early in the year. So he's already kind of adopted another brood!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Dad noticed her scoping out the balcony a couple of weeks ago and put up the privacy screen on his patio doors in preparation so she won't be disturbed when the time comes to sit on the nest.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: There are currently 8 eggs, and Mrs April Mallard is laying one per day, just like last year. She isn't sitting on them yet, she just lays one, stays for about half an hour, covers them up and goes off again.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
Lovelies, I emerge from beneath the rock I've hidden under all winter to give you some delightful news: 
There is currently a nest of duck eggs on a certain balcony, being watched over by my Dad. #OperationMallard 4 is a go. This is not a drill.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @AnaKellar Yeah, it is a big fear, having only recently clawed my way back from burnout. I need to pace myself, hence my checking in with my needs and what I need to do to best survive.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: But what that really comes down to is a balancing act of self-care and choosing where to put that creative energy that enables me to survive financially, but also create things that I am passionate about. That's the tricky thing for all creatives.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Don't get me wrong, I am so lucky and so damn privileged to be in a position where I can fight to survive through my creative work. It has taken a long time to get here, and it is precarious, but it is still a privilege.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Maybe one day I will write a novel that is successful enough for me to not have to worry as much as I do now, but there is no guarantee of that.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I am a 'mid-lister' - I am lucky enough to have had several books published and to earn royalties on them, but they don't bring in enough money for me to survive. So I supplement my income with audio book narration and Patreon support. And just lately, Ko-fi too.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: And @Bluebookballoon raised an excellent question: how do you define success? For me, success is being able to survive this late-stage capitalist dystopian nightmare we are forced to live in long enough to be able to write my next book. And the one after that.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @hh_tomte In the context of the poll, just supporting is reward. As the stuff you learn is as a result of the podcast, not a tiered reward, if that makes sense?

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I know it can be more complex than the two options in the poll - blunt tool y'all - so please do chat to me about how you approach supporting your creators as this is really baking my noodle.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: BUT I have avoided using any tiers, as I hate the thought of someone wanting to enjoy more of my work and not having enough in their supporting creators budget to get cool shiny stuff - as what I am currently offering isn't tailor-made or one-off stuff or whatever.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: ... and that is beautiful and it makes me want to cry, in all honesty, but it also kinda goes against most of the advice I've seen about running a Patreon account. It's dominated by the message: set cool tiers and rewards to be the most successful.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I posted to my lovely patrons about this, explaining that I would like to work on some other non-writing projects too, so would they be happy with a different form of reward? And... and they've floored me by saying that they just want to support me, whatever I create and...

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: ... as I am able to write more and I have a commissioned novel to deliver and two other novels I am DESPERATE to write. I am starting to feel that I need all of the water drawn from my writing well to go into novel writing without getting syphoned into a story a month too.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: This worked well while I was climbing my way out of autistic burnout / breakdown, as I could only write a tiny bit, and I wanted to feel liked I was earning that support as it is very much a lifeline for me at the moment. However, now I am feeling the need to shift things...

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: The reason I'm asking is this: I'm planning out the next few months of work and looking closely at where my energy is going. At the moment I write a short story every month that patrons get 3 weeks or so before newsletter subscribers. I've also done some patron-only videos.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Lovelies who support creators on Patreon, which of these is your primary motivation / source of joy for supporting? It would be brill if you could RT this so I can gather responses from as far and wide as possible.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @midsomerplots Every time I see an old lady riding a bicycle with a big basket on the front, I nod, knowing that soon, the village she lives in will be rocked by a terrible murder. Resistance is futile.

tweet: I finally watched Midsommar and ZOMG it was so good and it feels like my brain has been deeply, deeply nourished like it went on a weird spa day. I can't consume most horror but folk horror isn't scary for me, just so damn satisfying.

name: Emma Newman

tweet:
Well. That wasn't what I was planning to do this afternoon but here we are. Now I'm worried I've overshared, but so be it. I wanted to explain the strange path I took to find this charity, and process that journey too, I think.

Rest in peace, Grandad.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
Which is a much more practical, sensible and effective way to heal a generational trauma wound than trying to give someone a piano!

They do great work. And it fills me with joy to think that there are people out there helping kids to flourish in times like these.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
Awards for Young Musicians (@AwardsAYM) give financial support to talented kids and removes the very obstacles that had such a devastating impact on my grandfather, and by extension that side of my family. 

I set up a monthly contribution in his name.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
So I gave the piano to my aunt. It went to a loving home, is played every day and it felt good.

But something was still not right. So I did some research and found an amazing charity that supports musically talented children of low-income families.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
She plays piano, sings in a choir, is very involved with her church and does a tonne of charity work in her community. I asked her if there was anyone she knew who might benefit from it.

Weirdly, she had just made the decision to replace her late father's piano.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
You need room for it, and it needs maintenance (both require money), and my idealistic dream of being able to gift it to a child and help them in a way my grandfather wasn't helped was just unrealistic and stupid.

So I reached out to my aunt on the paternal side of my family.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
I got a piano tuner out to check it over as soon as lockdown eased and he said it was a fantastic piano, with years of life left in it.

But no matter how hard I tried, I couldn't find anywhere or anyone who could benefit from a free piano!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
It wasn't right. It should have been being played and loved. But the pandemic hit and I had a breakdown and it sat there. And I started therapy.

I decided it needed to go to a new home, and I wanted it to go to a place where it could help a child/children to play music.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: In taking the piano, I took on a burden, I later realised, both literally and metaphorically. It was so much heavier than I realised that I couldn't even get it into my upstairs flat. So it ended up in the garage, covered in blankets, and I felt guilty every time I saw it.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
I could feel her guilt and her pain at having to let it go. I knew she wanted it to stay in the family, but I don't play any instruments and my child plays guitar, not piano.

However, I couldn't say no, so I agreed to take it, even though I had nowhere to put it either.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: When he died, one of my aunts - also very talented at the piano - inherited grandad's. It was a beautiful modern upright and so dearly loved. When she and my uncle downsized a couple of years ago, she couldn't take the piano with her. She asked if I wanted it.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
And he was an angry and bitter father. I don't need to fill in the rest of the gaps here, do I?

Suffice to say, I firmly believe that him being denied his art and the expression of his talent and the opportunity to explore his potential had a profound impact on my family.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
Instead, my grandfather worked in a factory all his life. Apart from the bit when he was fighting in the second world war. He saw terrible, terrible things and would never talk about them.

He was kind to me, but he was an angry and bitter man.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
I learned, after he died, that when he was a child he won a scholarship to the Royal College of Music, thanks to his piano playing.

But his mother wouldn't let him go. They were so poor she needed him to work and they couldn't afford new clothes to send him off to fancy college.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
He was so talented. He would play Chopin and Beethoven and it was absolutely beautiful to listen to. And then after a while he'd come in, sit down, give a huge sigh and say 'Never mind'.

I had no idea why at the time.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: When I was a teenager, I used to spend pretty much every Sunday afternoon with him and my grandmother. Nana and I would chat in the living room and he would play the piano which was in the second bedroom. They lived in a tiny bungalow, so it was easy to listen to.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
I came to realise that a huge chunk of suffering in my life was down to the fact that emotional abuse was being repeated down the generations, and that a big root of that stemmed from my maternal grandfather.

He died over 20 years ago.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
Hey, I'm gonna tell you about one of those groups I'm supporting - but let me tell you a little story first, which lead me to this charity.

So I've been in therapy for over a year now, and one of the many things I've been learning about is generational trauma.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
And 2) The skillset and brain that I have are much better suited to writing novels than being the fierce revolutionary leader that the frustrated and angry part of me would rather be.

I am making peace with that, and supporting people who are changing the world.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
There's a constant internal debate - which I'm sure many of my fellow authors have - about whether writing books is the best use of my time and skillset, given the state of things.

But I always come back to two things: 1) Giving people other worlds through fiction is a good use.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
But still, money raised so far is a good thing too. 

I often feel guilty that I'm not doing more to make the world better, but I'm still recovering from a breakdown and I'm already doing all I can at the moment and having to learn to pace myself.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: And so far I've raised £392 for @Natures_Voice via my Ko-fi https://t.co/Nph8bTzz3S (I am donating 50% of my 'cups of tea' when 'Operation Mallard' is left in the message). I was really hoping to get it to £500 with the #OperationMallard 3 video, but it's taking a while.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So. The last time I felt like this I told people about my Dad and the ducks but it seems nesting time is over for the year. But you know, 27 ducklings rescued over two years is not bad at all. That's a good thing.

tweet:
Look, I'm not going to lie, I've had to step back for a little bit because I was sinking into despair about [gestures at constant shower of AWFUL] everything, and I promised myself I would not add to the anger and despair on Twitter. 
But blimey, it's hard to stay positive atm.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: ... And now you can see why I told you they were all safe first thing this morning! I am a monster when it comes to writing fiction, but to tell you about all that happened WITHOUT knowing they were all okay? That would have been too cruel! Lots of love to you all x

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So even though Dad's stand-by helpers didn't get called in (they would have taken too long to arrive at that time in the morning), a bloke just doing his job at the base of the building stepped up. There are good people in the world. And now we can all relax!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: And to think we were expecting this one to be easy as the weather was fine and there was no wind! Nope. Even more dramatic than the others! Dad made the decision to go ahead and hope the men below would help, and I am so glad they did.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Dad cleaned himself up and went to go and thank the bloke below but the work had finished and they'd gone! So if anyone knows a guy who did some work on Salford Quays early this morning who helped out with #operationmallard 3 - please connect us!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Anyway, all's well that ends well! They swam off, Dad saw they were all together and safe and then he could breathe again! Turns out the lifts were only out of service for 15 minutes - just happened to be the most crucial 15 minutes of the day!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Dad was hollering guidance to the bloke below who started to corral them back together, then a woman on a bike stopped to help and eventually the family got to the water. My poor Dad was a bit of a wreck! I was, just when he was telling me what happened!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Poor Dad was stranded on the balcony, helpless, as Mrs Mallard was unable to use her previous route to the water due to the barriers and workers down there. She went a different route and was briefly separated from the gaggle of ducklings who started to wander off without her!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: But thankfully, one of the blokes down there did hear him, and looked pretty confused for a few moments! Then he clocked what was happening, grabbed the bucket when it got to the ground and followed Dad's instructions to let the ducklings out.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Mrs Mallard came back to circle the bucket mid-air, quacking loudly, as Dad was shouting down to the workmen to try to get some help, but the generator was so loud they couldn't hear him as he was so far up! Can you imagine?!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: He FINALLY found the last duckling who'd managed to get around one of the barriers and was literally 2 inches from the drop of death! Dad (thank goodness he had military training - I'd be dead of stress by then) scooped them up, put them in the bucket and started lowering.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Cue five minutes of FRANTIC searching of the balcony. Mrs Mallard went off to the water and he was so worried the bond was going to be broken due to the generator noise, but the ducket was still amplifying their peeps, and they'd had a lot of bonding time since hatching.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: As he had before, he went out, got shouted at by the momma duck (and she sprayed him with poo!) who then took off as he started to load the ducklings into the ducket. But many of them ran off to hide behind planters. He found 8, but one was missing...

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: ... only to discover that Mrs Mallard was clearly about to leave the nest! He whipped out his phone, filmed her leaving and counted the 9 ducklings as they plopped out onto the balcony. He had to get the ducklings down then and there!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So he went back to his flat to phone down to the main desk in the lobby to ask if they'd warn the workers below about the imminent ducket arrival, and to ask if maybe they could move the generator round the corner so it wasn't so loud...

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Only to arrive at the elevators and discover that all 3 were out of service due to maintenance! Nine floors up, he didn't want to go all the way down and back up again by the stairs as it would leave the nest unattended too long.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: But no. She stayed put. Dad waited. Then, to his horror, a group of workmen arrived right at the base of the building and started up a generator! He knew the ducklings would have to go to the water soon, so he went to speak to them...

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: It might have been that the last 2 or 3 eggs hadn't hatched, or she just didn't fancy leaving yet but either way, they all settled down by evening and stayed the night. Dad got up just before 4am, thinking she'd want to leave at dawn, like last year.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: #Operationmallard 3 lovelies! Let me tell you how stressful Dad's morning was! Yesterday (21st of June) lots of the ducklings hatched, but Mrs Mallard showed no desire to leave the nest and take the family down to the water. Dad could only count about 6 ducklings at most.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: There was Drama, but I am very busy this morning with work stuff, so I will come back later to tell you the whole story. I just wanted to put you all out of your misery and tell you the happy ending! (Even though my author brain is telling me off for jumping to the end!)

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Good morning my lovelies! I am delighted to tell you that all 9 ducklings and their momma are now safely swimming about in the water after another successful #operationmallard 😀

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @aroomofmyown1 Not when it is hatching week!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So, bless him, he's going to go to bed at 9:30pm tonight and has set his alarm for 4am. (he's already shifted his sleep cycle to be up at dawn for her) I doubt he will sleep well tonight! Or that I will, for that matter!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Well, both Dad and I are starting to think that Mrs Mallard and the ducklings are going to spend the night on Dad's balcony and leave tomorrow morning. He said the nest is much more settled now and it's late evening now, so not enough time to find a new home.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Me anxiously waiting for updates on #operationmallard 3 from Dad: https://t.co/xJgaFFs44M

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Another #operationmallard 3 mini-update: More ducklings have hatched, but Mrs Mallard is still sitting tight on the nest, so we think there's still a couple of eggs left to hatch. Some of the first hatched are getting fidgety, but Momma is staying put for now!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @NomadicWriter It's this duck's second brood on Dad's balcony (her first was Operation Mallard 1 last year). The brood earlier this year was from another duck!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Local helpers are on stand-by waiting for Dad's call. I am, again, gutted I can't be there. But if this happens again next year, hopefully I will be able to watch in person.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: ... remains to be seen. Dad always takes his lead from the mother, and she might decide to stay put if the last duckling hatches late in the day. They are born with enough fuel, so to speak, for at least 24 hours, so if she waits until dawn tomorrow, they'll all be fine.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
Mini update: So it looks like a couple of the ducklings have hatched but are mostly being kept under Mrs Mallard as the rest are still yet to hatch. Dad expects them to hatch over the afternoon.

Whether they need to be lowered in the 'ducket' this afternoon...

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
[KLAXON] First ducklings sighted! It's happening, my lovelies! #operationmallard 3 is a go, I repeat, Operation Mallard 3 is a go! 

I thought it wouldn't be as exciting, third time round. Reader, I was so wrong!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @nicoleyc17 I am just so glad I can make so many people happy :)

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @nicoleyc17 Once he was sure it wasn't the duck who'd had 11 ducklings 2 weeks earlier, he was delighted! We both worried that something terrible had happened at first, but now we know it's the original duck, we are so happy. He feels very privileged :)

tweet:
... we may be seeing the ducklings today! She is more agitated, standing up a lot and generally behaving like hatching is imminent. 

I will obviously keep you posted!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: He counted the 28 (+/- 1) day incubation period from the first day that she sat for 22 hours on the eggs. However, the day before that she sat for 12 hours, and the weather up there has been really warm and sunny for weeks, so....

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So Dad and I were expecting the current clutch of 9 eggs to hatch on Wednesday. However, he phoned me this morning to say that Momma duck's behaviour ('OG Mrs Mallard' from 2020) has changed today, so they might be hatching earlier than we thought!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic

That just about sums up the last week. Mostly due to my computer breaking, taking 3 days of my time in attempts to fix, only for it to be a hardware issue. It's in for repairs now. 

I feel like I need repairs too. Tell me something good is happening.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
So I stopped. And I have zero regrets. By the time public appearances start again I will probably be pretty much entirely silver white.

Ah well. Who cares? Not me anymore :)

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
I was so attached to that being a part of me, I couldn't bear to lose it!

Then January last year I just looked in the mirror when I was about to dye it again and thought 'why I am doing this? Who is this for? I hate dying my hair. I hate the waste of time and resources.'

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
I started going grey when I was 13 (and I do think it was stress related). Then for years I had this cute intensely white streak that people thought I had dyed in! That always made me laugh! 

Then 4 or so years ago (maybe?) I started dying around the streak as more grey appeared

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @countstockula NOOOOOOOOO! SO I WAS RIGHT ALL ALONG!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: It's really hard to shrug off all the toxic crap that advertising and the media piles upon us. And I am so embarrassed that it still gets to me! In everyday life I am not vain but as soon as it is work-related - EEEEEEK! All those demons surface!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
... they are unlikely to be the sort of person I should be paying attention to anyway.

And there was also the fact that all that fear over my weight and my hair etc was actually just my brain trying to protect me from doing a scary thing.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
And I have absolutely LOVED watching other women like me on YouTube. I love seeing people who aren't bloody supermodel gorgeous just being truthful about their lives and their struggles. 

So I thought; sod it. Be brave, Em. And if someone hates on you for how you look...

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: But then I came to the conclusion that it was far more important to reach just one person and help them. Hopefully more than one! And I'm a feminist, dammit! This was my chance to stand up as an older, greying, overweight woman in her 40s and say something!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: But I did the work in therapy. I examined those feelings. I sat with the nasty little thoughts about how everyone would hate me if they saw my face, about how I'd get loads of horrible comments. That I'd risk being seen, really *seen* as I processed something so personal.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So I had to get over this camera-shyness to do that. And it took months. MONTHS! And tangled up in that is terrible self-esteem, hating the way I look and, I'm ashamed to admit, some vanity too. Lockdown has not been kind to my body or my hair!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: And, as much as I hated the thought of it, YouTube videos of me just... talking about it seemed to be the way to go. It's a way to reach a very broad audience. It's within my technical ability. And talking to camera feels best for lip-reading accessibility too.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: And not just women, obviously, but we do seem to have a much harder time getting the correct diagnosis. I want to help anyone who's been diagnosed late to feel less alone in that grief and that re-evaluation of everything about ourselves.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Then fast-forward to a few months ago when I was processing the autism diagnosis and feeling painfully aware that I was not the only older woman who'd struggled for DECADES before getting a diagnosis. I really wanted to try to help them feel less alone.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I was also aware that people have made assumptions about me throughout my life because of the way I look. I didn't want any of that to cloud the impression someone might have of my work. But... I just had to suck it up.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: But it wasn't just that I didn't get it. It was also that I felt, very strongly, that it could actively impede a connection. I don't like the way I look. I am also a woman. And society judges women by their appearance in a very, very unpleasant way.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Again: makes no sense to me. I connect with characters in a book. I may well develop a sort of intellectual crush on the writer if the book really deeply resonates with me. But the photo of them? Nah. So I really didn't want it. (I lost that battle).

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: As a reader, I never look at author pics in the back of books, I just stumble upon them occasionally and don't give them a second thought. So I couldn't understand the value of having one. Apparently, IIRC, it helps the reader to feel more connected on a human level.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: It made no sense to me. My book was the most important thing and had nothing to do with my face! Everything I wanted to say was conveyed through the words within, not my face! Why did it have to be printed in the book and used for publicity?! HORROR!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Talking to camera goes against every instinct I have. And being photographed too. Since my mid-teens I have literally run away from cameras. When I became an author and was told I needed to have a picture taken of me for the back of my book, I was appalled!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Actually... I feel like talking about how hard it is to make videos like this. Not in a technical sense (though I am still on a very steep learning curve), more a 'being seen' sense.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
It also contains a Star Wars joke, a Simpsons reference and one of my favourite film quote GIFs (which I only learned how to include in the upper corner of videos today!) - as well as all the actual proper content. 

I'm just this nerd, y'know?

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
And the laying season can run until July so... so I have learned the lesson not to think "Okay, that's done for this year!" when it comes to my Dad's balcony and ducks.

I'll let you know when she starts sitting so we can mark our calendars.

DID I JUST TYPE THAT?!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
Apparently it's quite common for a bird to take a used nest - and it's a brilliant spot. Sheltered by those tall grasses, lots of soil and soft down there already. 

Dad said today that she's been finding bits of the old shells and eating them for the calcium!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Dad had left all the down from the previous nest there for some starlings that were nesting - he'd been watching them carry it off for their nest. But he also saw a duck fly past several times with two drakes over the past couple of weeks, and he thinks it was her.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Her behaviour matches last year's Mrs Mallard much more closely too - she favours early mornings more than... this years... argh! I'm still working out what to call them both! They can both be Mrs Mallard of course, but we didn't give them first names. MY WRITER BRAIN IS HURTING!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
So once we were confident about what was going on, and who this duck is, we decided to let you all know. 

Operation Mallard 3 looks like it is happening a whole year early! She's laid 6-7 eggs so far, but isn't sitting to hatch them yet.

I...I can't believe this is my life now.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
"There isn't facial recognition technology for ducks, Em," Dad replied. "And if there is, I don't have it here! And it just didn't occur to me that she could be a different duck! I just thought she was month early!" 

But no, this duck just heard about this great spot, obviously!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
"This isn't narratively tidy, Dad," I said, only half-serious. "I can't believe this is happening. I thought we had a whole year to recover! And we misidentified the last duck!"

I feel weirdly guilty about that! The whole time we thought she'd come back, but no!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: He called me this afternoon, sent me more footage, and yeah, we are pretty confident that the Mrs Mallard from 2020 has come back to nest again, and that the Mrs Mallard who left two weeks ago with 11 ducklings was just a different duck!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: It's hard to tell when you're using a mobile phone video filmed through patio door glass! We both concluded that Mrs Mallard from two weeks ago and the Mrs Mallard he saw that morning were different ducks. He wanted to get more footage and observe her for a couple more days.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: We really wanted to be sure they were different - and whether this latest duck was Mrs Mallard from last year! So I pulled stills from both the Operation Mallard 1 and 2 videos and sent them to Dad. We pored over them, both of us starting to look a bit like this: https://t.co/k3PVH1S3by

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: After a pause I said "PLOT TWIST" and then we both laughed and talked about identification: the shape of the 'eye-line' - the black feathers that run back from the eye, and also the shape of the head and the patterning of the feather colouration - which is subtle but present.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
"What do you mean, sort of?"

"I think the duck I saw this morning wasn't the one who nested earlier this year. I think she's the Mrs Mallard from last year. I think the duck who left two weeks ago wasn't actually 2020's Mrs Mallard at all. She was a different duck!"

"Oh shit!"

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
But we were still worried. He said he'd find out about telling the difference between female ducks and he'd get back to me once he knew whether it was her.

Hours later he calls me back. "It's not Mrs Mallard," he said and I breathed a sigh of relief. Then he adds "Sort of."

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: "I think she's a different duck," Dad said. And then told me why. You see, mallards look after their ducklings for 50-60 days after hatching, and Mrs Mallard's brood only left 20 days ago. "Even if the worst had happened, she probably wouldn't come back to lay again so soon."

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
He sent back: "Well, it looks like a duck, sounds like a duck... yep, it's a duck 🦆😯" 

I phoned him. "Is it Mrs Mallard?" I asked, very worried that she had returned so quickly. Where were the ducklings? What was going on?

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
He said he did a proper double-take. He couldn't believe it. It was like Groundhog Day, but with ducks. He was just stumbling to the kitchen first thing in the morning, glanced out the window... and there was a duck there!

"IS THAT ANOTHER DUCK?!" I replied.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:

name: Emma Newman

tweet: I hasten to add, as several are suggesting it, that I don't feel that this one change in the middle of the video merits a 'director's cut'. Maybe I'm wrong. But I am tempted to put it up and link to it from a card embedded at that spot in the main video.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @k1k2lee I wondered about that, but as the changed bit is right in the middle, and the only change, it didn't sit right with me.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So I guess my question is: do you want to hear my utterly appalling, ridiculous, whimsical duck, chicken and me version of the Star Wars Main Title music, or should I just chalk this up to grim experience and be grumpy about wasted time?

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: And whilst the latter makes my perfectionist soul happy, the video has been linked to by lots of places by now, and broken links make me sad. So.... I have replaced it with some nice-but-wrong music from the YT library and am tempted to upload my silly version as a new video.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: And you can't replace an already uploaded video. Which was my next thought. So I was left with the choice of trimming out the whole Star Wars crawl joke (my inner nerd weeps at that), replacing with library music or silence, or deleting the video and reuploading.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I can see why, now I think about it. But what really ticks me off is that they weren't clear about that. If that had been clear, I wouldn't have uploaded that original video, I'd have waited until I had done the replacement music.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I just loved the joke so much, I let that get in the way of good sense really. Anyway, I make my silly version and go to replace the original music, only to find I can't. I can only use YouTube music library tracks, I can't upload my own segment.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: When I uploaded it, I knew the music was copyrighted, and that was fine, I thought, as YouTube said that segment of audio could easily be replaced. Great, I thought, I'll sort that out once I have a spare moment.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I've spent most of the afternoon making a very, very silly version of the Star Wars Main title music involving me quacking, impersonating a chicken and me 'doo-doo-doo'ing the them, only to discover I can't replace the copyrighted version in my Operation Mallard 2 video.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @TimClarePoet LOL! Admittedly, I am remembering editing Tea and Jeopardy, which was a HUGE amount of editing work, due to the audio theatre aspects of it. A more standard podcast would be a lot easier I guess. But then I worry about being boring and not adding anything new!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @TimClarePoet I'm torn. I do like podcasting, but I hate audio editing! And I think I want to experiment with video a bit more. For a future project I have planned, I may well do a podcast version of a YouTube thing and release simultaneously. Not sure.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I've committed to being open about mental health and being autistic. This is part of that. Good things, as well as bad things, can be really disruptive and need to be processed too. And if you've read all of this, and want to stick around, yay!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So I've been doing some work on getting my head straight around all of this. And I remembered a thought I had a while ago about people-pleasing and online life, namely that I am allowed to talk about what I want to, and if people are not interested, they can unfollow. Easy!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: What if I wanted to talk about sci-fi? Or writing? Or recovering from a breakdown? Or autism? Or being a writer or the latest audiobook project? I felt I'd be... disappointing people? Again, this is all my baggage and brain weasels that I've been wrestling with for a few days.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: It freaked me out. It's not anyone's fault, at all! I just had a bit of a wobble, because I started to worry that if all of these people were here because I'd talked about my dad looking after a duck... they might not be very happy if I talked about other stuff.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: It's not a perfect metaphor, but I hope that conveys some of the online social weirdness of the past few weeks. When I realised that things had really changed, I suddenly felt like I had more people listening to anything I might say.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Once things settled again, and Mrs Mallard and her ducklings had swam off into the sunset, I thought I'd be chatting in the little pub I was used to again. But... but it seems like a lot of people have come back to my corner of the pub with me.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Then when you go viral, it's suddenly like you're not in a little pub anymore, it's the size of a stadium.  And many more people are listening, reacting, amplifying, and replying to you. It's not like a conversation anymore as there are too many replies to process and respond to.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Okay, metaphor time! I have always seen Twitter as being a bit like a weird pub. There are hundreds of conversations going on at once in your corner of the pub, and occasionally a few more people might engage with your conversation than normal, and that's fine.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: 'But Em,' you might say, 'you've gained over 23k followers from Operation Mallard. Surely this was to be expected?' Ummm... no. No, it wasn't. I assumed that the majority of those people were here for ducks and nothing else. And lots of you are... still here. [gives awkward wave]

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So when I came back once the dust was settling and a non Op Mallard tweet got hundreds of likes I... I hitched my skirts up and ran away, quite frankly. I find attention difficult... due to a combination of cPTSD, other trauma and being autistic I guess.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Before Operation Mallard, I was used to tweeting and getting a few likes and replies. Going viral was a shock and overwhelming, but I just hadn't realised how much people needed a feel good story - nor that I would be the one providing it that day.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I have a confession to make: I got rather freaked out by how many people responded to my tweets a couple of weeks ago, just innocuous 'glad things are going back to normal after all the lovely duck events' stuff.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Hello my lovelies. I'd like to talk some stuff through on here, as I've realised I've been hiding away from Twitter again and I kinda don't want to do that anymore.

tweet: I'm also trying hard to hold onto the positives in the world (while making sure I stay educated and aware of the terrible things) because despair is never far away. There are good people, doing good things. It's just that they are in the news a lot less.

tweet: Lovelies following #operationmallard, do you agree that it is our civic duty to give those 11 #StarWarsDay ducklings the best, most delightfully nerdy Star Wars related names this side of Tatooine?

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: May the force be with you, little ducklings and Mrs Mallard. And may the force be with all of you. Thank you so much for coming on this wild ride with me and my dad. Lots of love to you all. xxx

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: The BBC were there, not sure when it will be on the telly, but it will be! All 11, with Mrs Mallard, swam towards the River Irwell and seemed very happy and well. I will collate all the videos my Dad did and get that out ASAP, probably tomorrow.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @Kavey LOL I WAS LIKE THAT ALL DAY!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: And you know what that means? THEY ARE STAR WARS DUCKLINGS as it is May the Fourth (be with you!) - I AM SO DELIGHTED AND RELIEVED I CANNOT EVEN! I am literally shaking as I type, with relief, with happiness, with the sheer joy of it in the midst of all the horror.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So, after 8 HOURS of anxious waiting, I can finally tell you all that Operation Mallard 2: Electric Boogaloo was a SUCCESS! All 11 ducklings hatched and made it to the water. Every. Single. One. My Dad is a legend!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I got a couple of updates over the afternoon - Dad thought she was waiting for the weather to improve as they were all just staying in the nest and not going anywhere - and then, at 16:45 he sent me the best news!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Oh, and there's a third reason (THREE MAIN WEAPONS OF THE SPANISH INQUISITION! Sorry, it's a habit) I didn't know how long it would take. I didn't want 1000s of messages asking for the latest update before I knew myself!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Two reasons for keeping quiet while we were waiting: One - what if local people turned up and ended up waiting for hours or worse, scaring Mrs Mallard when the ducklings were lowered? Two - what if something went wrong? I couldn't 'live tweet' a disaster.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: It wasn't just worrying about the ducklings, but worrying about all of you! I promised my dad that I would not tweet anything until it was all done. IT WAS SO HARD NOT TO TELL YOU ALL. I'm glad, considering how the day went! You might have been messes too!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: More. Tense. Waiting. I felt like getting a cigar (even though I don't smoke) just so I could pace up and down holding it, like expectant fathers in old movies waiting for baby to arrive. Dad was pacing in his apartment too! Watching, waiting...

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Half an hour or so later I got a mini video update and the first glimpse of the ducklings (I almost died - they are so cute!) but not all 11 yet. (I will include it in my video summary like I did for the first Operation Mallard.)

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I checked he was okay. He was a little bit tense but absolutely fine. I was A MESS. BBC news were waiting too, and I was so nervous things would go wrong. I just couldn't bear the thought of something going wrong and having to tell you all!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: 4 hours later I cracked and messaged him. 'Everything ok?' I asked. 'Slow going,' he replied. ' Chicks are hatching but staying on nest for time being. Mum has settled down, still eggs to hatch I think.🐣' (Dad is a big emoji fan)

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I wished him luck again and then waited. And waited. And... waited. Literally hours went by. My traitorous brain concocted all sorts of terrible scenarios. But I trust my Dad and knew I should leave him to it. Still... my brain can be SO ANNOYING :)

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: That side is a bit more sheltered today, and even though he really didn't want to bring the 'ducket' into the flat, it would be for literally 2-3 seconds, and the additional shelter might be needed. He was so calm! He'd thought it all through.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: He had a plan though (he's my dad, he always does!) that if the wind was still too high when the time came to escort the ducklings to the ground, he'd use the second tiny balcony on the other side of the living room.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Even though Dad's friend would be helping (and was now on standby), and he had a second rope (as he explained in this video: https://t.co/ZLWEHTXjlF), winds that high were very worrying. Reader, I was FRETFUL.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: A storm blew through yesterday with gale force winds and rain. Today it's much sunnier but the wind this morning was still just over 20mph - and 9 floors up, it really whips around the building.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I got a message from my Dad at about 8:30am, saying that Operation Mallard 2 was about to begin! I replied, wishing him luck, then he phoned and said he'd seen two tiny little duckling heads peeping out so far. One problem though: the wind.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Lovelies, I have an #operationmallard update! A BIG ONE! Pull up a chair, maybe grab a blanket and a cuppa? You're about to get on a bit of an emotional rollercoaster...

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I hope that reassures everyone! Sorry I can't respond individually to everyone, I honestly can't keep up! Lots of love to you all x

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Using the 'ducket' means that Momma and ducklings can hear each other throughout - which is absolutely critical - and it's only a few seconds of separation. Also far, far less stressful for them than many minutes of trying to corral them all through an alien environment.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: A few people have asked why he's not just taking them down in the lift. He feels that the bucket approach causes the least distress to Mrs Mallard, makes sure that the maternal bond is preserved and is also the fastest solution.

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Good morning, my lovelies. In case you missed it last night, I've put an update video on YouTube all about how Dad is preparing for the big day - he made some footage for you containing cute diagrams! https://t.co/ZLWEHTXjlF  #operationmallard

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
So Mrs Mallard is currently dosing in the sun and Dad is fully prepared for the big day. The weather is terrible on Monday so we are both really, really hoping that it is going to be Wednesday plus or minus a day. 
That's all for now, lots of love to you all!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I just melted when I heard this, and said "aaaaawwww, that's so lovely!" and Dad said "I've not painted flowers on them or anythin', Em!" and it made me laugh :)

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Okay... what else did Dad say...? Oh yes! Mindful of the duckling who fell out of the nest early on last year, he's made some rudimentary platforms so if any tumble out this year before the rest are hatched, they can climb back up to momma <3

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: I should add - thanks to @SiameseCaroline for the question - that she lays one egg per day until all are done, and only once all are laid does she start to sit on them for hours every day. That way they all hatch on the same day :)

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So I am correcting my opinion of Mr Mallard. He is around, but much harder to catch on camera! Dad has seen and heard him calling for Mrs Mallard from the bridge below and heard her calling back. Like: "YOU COMIN' OUT, LUV?"- "AYE, JUST A MINUTE, LET ME COVER THE EGGS!" :)

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: Once all the eggs were laid, he called for her on most days and they would go off for a bit of time together, when she wasn't off on the razzle with the other ducks who came calling for her. She's quite popular, our Mrs Mallard ;)

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: So Mr Mallard is nearby! He stands on the big white bridge over the canal and they quack at each other! Earlier in the nesting cycle, they saw much more of each other - she lays an egg per day so they had to... do some lovin' daily ;) [feels so British and awkward!]

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet: @monkeyislanduk Bury, so not far :) And he's lived in so many places his accent is much softer now. The rest of my family's accents are really broad and I absolutely adore it! And it's very useful for audiobook narration too!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic

description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
So it looks like Dad and I are going to be on BBC Radio 2 tomorrow, all being well. I called him to ask him if he'll be in. "I'm not going anywhere now until the ducklings have hatched. Just in case they come early." 
The DEDICATION of this man. I adore him. #operationmallard

tweet:
Okay... getting a grip now. 
2. It's helped people to find the stuff I've written and filmed about mental health and getting a late autism diagnosis, and it is helping people (they've told me!)

I am so glad it is making people smile and also helping them too. Lots of love xxx

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
There are two things I love most about all the #operationmallard stuff.

1. Thousands of people are discovering how wonderful my Dad is and I just could not be prouder of him. Honestly, my heart is just bursting that you all get to share that with me too. [does little cry]

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
@J_Sklars @BBCNWT I love that bit with the runner! It makes me laugh so much, it's joyful! And my dad is so chill about it - even after all the bucket stress! 
If there were more dads in the world like my dad, it would be a better place, so thank you for striving x

tweet: @madcap_007 My understanding is that he wanted to minimise the risk of the maternal bond being broken. Keeping them outside, where they can all hear each other calling, is less stressful for them and helps to keep the maternal bond intact and strong.And much faster too.

tweet:
Like me, he is just so delighted that it's given so many people a moment of happiness. 

To everyone saying he reminds them of their dad, now gone, please accept a big virtual hug from me.

Also, I absolutely love all your bird friend stories!

name: Emma Newman
description: Writer, audiobook narrator, tea drinker. Dressmaker, gamer and roleplayer. Author of urban fantasy & science fiction novels. Occasional YouTuber. #Autistic
tweet:
Ooooh blimey, the #operationmallard thing is really um... it's really going crazy. 

I am struggling to keep up with all the messages, sorry! Just wanted to say thanks for all the kind words about my lovely Dad. I've been chatting to him on the phone about it.

Thank you so much for all your lovely comments and stories! Sending lots of love and nice cups of tea* to you all!
